intro: Jaltomata neei, commonly known as the Neel's jaltomata, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its tubular flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine pubescence, while its flowers are often blue or violet in color. Jaltomata neei is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
